boardgame.name: Junta
Golpe
フンタ
槍桿政權
boardgame.description: Players represent various families in Republica de los Bananas._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each game turn has between 7 and 9 rounds, drawing cards, President assigns roles, foreign aid money is drawn, the president proposes a budget which is voted on, locations are chosen, there are assassination attempts, then the bank may be open or not, there may be a coup and aftermath, then the next round starts._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game is for 4 to 7 players (although there are 2 and 3 player variants). A president for life (El Presidente) is elected and then she or he allocates roles for all other players. Depending upon his or her office and the various cards they hold, each player has a certain number of votes. These are important for the first vote to elect El Presidente and then there are votes each turn on the budget proposed by the President. The budget starts when the President draws 8 money cards face down from the money deck (which varies in denomination from $1 to $3) and proposes allocations. Not everyone will be included in the budget and the amounts are at the President's discretion. The President can keep undisclosed foreign aid money._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players may attempt to assassinate the other players including the President by guessing where they will be from among five locations. Players who successfully assassinate another player take that player's unbanked money, the only safe money is the money that has been deposited in a players' Swiss bank account, and the only way to get to the bank is to survive the assassination round._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;If players are unhappy, see an advantage, or just want to, and there is a 'coup excuse', they can start a coup. A coup sees players compete using armed forces to control a majority of the 5 power centers. Rebel players control the forces of the role which they were assigned prior to the coup (e.g. army, navy, air force), and players loyal to the President do the same, seeking to control the strongholds until the coup is over. At the conclusion of each coup players who have control of the 5 power centres vote to be pro-President or pro-Junta determining if the President stays, or the Junta wins and elects a new President. And someone is sent to the firing squad._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players assassinated or killed simply become another member of their family and begin again with new cards, but keeping any of their family's funds deposited in their Swiss bank account._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game is won by whoever has the most pesos in their Swiss bank account when the money runs out._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

For sale here are expansions for the games Dune and Junta. This is NOT the game, but expansions that originally appeared in the Magazine The VIP of Gaming, issue #2 from 1986. The Dune expansion adds 8 new treachery cards, and the rules for their use. The Junta expansion adds three new political positions. Included for sale are all the new parts for both expansions on cardstock (you cut out the cards and pieces), and copies of the additional rules for both games. The magazine is not included. Please contact me with any questions.

This game is listed as part of a group that I am selling to benefit the Sun Tzu Military History Museum. The games were owned by friend who passed this past January, and he wanted to make sure his games were sold to benefit his charity of choice. Many of the games have rules underlining, which I have tried to catalog in the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s condition. I have also tried to give as complete and accurate description as possible. Games are complete, unless otherwise noted. A few of the older games may have handmade replacement counters. Again, I have tried to identify these items in the game description. If you are concerned about specifics of condition that are not in the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s description, please geekmail me, and I will give a very specific accounting of whatever you may have questions on. For any games that are missing pieces, I heartily recommend checking the BGG Spare Parts 2012 wanted/have geeklist. Several users of this site have been very generous in helping find missing components! http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/76707/2012-spare-parts-resource-list Prices are firm on single purchases, but I will consider offers on multiple games. I will ship multiple purchases together to try and save you money on shipping. Photos are available upon request! Local pickup available in the Denver Metro area.
